reviews.title: Hate it!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at Holiday Villa Langkawi this week with my friends and I was overall pleased with the hotel service and staff. Although the hotel's a little old, the room/bathroom were clean and everything were in order, not forgetting the hotel staff were very friendly and responsive at our requests too. We loved the huge pool and the ample capacity of the hotel here, and the fact that there's a good mix of tourists. The beach is connected from the pool area, and the beach is clean as well. There are water sports available nearby, eg; parasailing. Breakfast provided at the hotel is okay, but we did not try any lunch /dinner. Instead we found SUNDAY Bistro & Restaurant which is located some 200m away , to serve extremely good food and drinks at very reasonable prices. We loved the ambience and the wonderful service rendered by the staff there. They have such bright smiles and welcoming air as you walk in the mini-manor-turned-restaurant. Another must-try is The Loaf, a bakery cafe located at Pantai Kok Harbour Front. Give their Iced Latte a try, it's worth the visual satisfaction. While HV is located at Pantai Tengah, do try to check out the beach stretch located further up called Pantai Cenang, Langkawi main beach. The last time i was there (sometime christmas last year) it was in a bad state of litters but now it is so clean and there are even more crowd there, with lots of water sports available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 6 days in Langkawi at the Holiday villa with extended family. We were somewhat nervous after reading some of the poor reviews but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Whilst certainly not a 5 star resort, the rooms were clean and comfortable, the facilities were great and the location was fantastic. We found the staff friendly and accomodating. At this time of year the island is in low season so perhaps negative reviews about this place have been when the resort is full. I must say we did not spend much time in our rooms as there is so much to do on the Island as well as hanging around the fab pool all day. We did eat one night at the hotel and to be honest it was pretty average. There are so many other options close by that serve fantastic food and are so cheap (Thoroughly recommend breakfast at cactus across the road!)We loved Langkawi and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the basis of the price, I suppose we could not really expect the hotel to be luxurious, but it was rather worse than we hoped. Very 1980's with a dark-stained wood effect everywhere. Rather smelly in the corridors, bathroom mouldy with damaged tiling. Blankets with holes in, a 'sticky' sofa bed that smelt like it hadn't had it's covers washed for years. Cheap, boring, stale and dried-out buffet breakfast (a description which also matched some the guests!)
reviews.title: Rather tacky

reviews.text: Finally, when we checked out, they tried to overcharge us on the basis that our package did not cover the two weekend nights included in our stay, despite the fact that we had a printout from booking on the web that denied this! Not totally awful, but very tacky and jaded - it would be best to try somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read reviews about the Holiday Villa and decided to keep an open mind - some were positive, some negative. We arrived on our first day at around 9.30am, checked in and only had to wait about an hour for our room to be ready, not bad considering check-in is 2pm. The room was clean and tidy with a great view of the pool and beach with fabulous air-conditioning. A good sized bathroom with the room cleaned daily. The pool is just amazing. We spent hours swimming, meeting other guests from various countries, playing water volleyball, sunbaking and having a snack from the pool bar. The location of the resort is excellent. There is a convenience store just across the road and a collection of restaurants but worth working a few kilometres up the road to a larger variety of restaurants and bars. The Orchid Restaurant has the biggest prawns we've ever seen which is located a few shops away from our favourite little pizza haunt "Artisans", best pizza we've ever had. The Holiday Villa offers an amazing buffet breakfast, the choice is endless. I will definately return to this magic island and fabulous hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly and from the moment we boarded the plane back to K.L. we were talking about our return trip. Can't wait to get back!!
reviews.title: Loved the Holiday Villa

likes.liked: — The Location, The rooms the staff

reviews.text: The checkin took us 10 mins. After which we went straight to our room, our luggage was brought in as we entered the room. The room was very clean , no cockroaches , the room didn't smell or anything. the staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. They even sent us a cake on my hubby's b'day. The breakfast buffet was also very good. i was spoilt for choice. i didn't try any other restaurant so i can't comment on the food. we tried a lot of local food and had dinners at Maya's Restaurant which is a walkable 5 mins from the hotel. The food is good, service is quick and the environment is so calm and peaceful, something i was longing for in a long time considering i'm a bangalore resident. The owner is very sweet and friendly. And yes the pool awesome! we had a splendid time at the pool. To sum it a great experience. Go for it ppl :) . Wish u all have a stay as pleasant as mine. :)
reviews.title: good value for the money

reviews.text: our above average rating is on the basis of the cheap price - we were on a package of stay 8 & pay 4. We stayed at HV with a group of friends; then just the two of us moved on to Casa Del Mar. As a couple we usually stay in 4 - 4.5 star accommodation, so we were pleasantly surprised with HV. For what we paid we considered it was pretty good. The breakfast was very good with freshly cooked eggs and waffles. Drinks were cheap at the bars. The pool and beach areas were excellent and the aspect from the beach was beautiful; with an archipelago of islands nearby. There were plenty of sunbeds and good opportunity to place them in either shade or direct sun. Our room had a couple of minor problems initially (fridge not working; safe locked) but these were quickly fixed. The room and bathroom were clean - although there was a peculiar smell in the fridge (just what did our predecessors leave in there?). We found the service to be pretty good; at reception; responding to our minor problems; and for room service (eg buckets of ice). We had a balcony looking down on the garden area in front of the pool and this was a good aspect. The bedding was comfortable but poor for couples - 2 single kings, each with separate bedding, pushed together. Inside the room (and others we visited) there's a type of day bed / divan and we thought this was quite useless, having a metal frame and inadequate cushioning. We were lucky that the weather was great for our 8 day stay; as I think the room would have not been very comfortable if bad weather had kept us indoors more. The location is great - apart from the beautiful beach environment, there are convenience stores and some really good restaurants in close walking distance. There was a group of 14 of us and on a couple of occasions we were able to eat and drink to our content for $30-40 AUD per couple. We also ate at more expensive places which had great food but were closer to Australian restaurant prices. A few friends used the spa and thought it was great. There's always plenty of taxis outside and taxi rides to anywhere are cheap. There's not much shopping of note nearby but it's easy to get to Kuah by taxi and some good shopping there (Lagkawi Fair was very good). Holiday Villa guests represented a wide variety of races; which made the experince more interesting. If you're on a tightish budget, then HV is very good - it was a higher standard than we expected beforehand. The two of us continued our holiday alone, in a suite at Casa Del Mar. CDM certainly lives up to its No.1 rating - but then, we also paid a lot more money than HV. Our attitude was that because we saved so much on accommodation at HV, then we could afford to treat ourselves to a suite at CDM. If we hadn't gone to HV specifically with a group of friends, then just the two of us would have probably been in just a room (rather than suite) at CDM or a garden view room at Pelangi. Both of those options would have cost a lot more than HV and I'm not sure that there would have been a great difference in end value. So, while still a believer in "what you pay is what you get" I do consider that HV proved to be excellent value for the money.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We were a little apprehensive about the hotel after reading some of the reviews, however it wasn't that bad. We stayed for 4 nights and it was great. There were no cockroaches and the room that we got was rather spacious and comfortable. The service could have been a little better, the staff was not as friendly as in Thailand. But it was good value for money. The menu was a little limited but then there is such a variety outside the hotel so it was not so difficult. . The location is superb with a lovely beach. The Spa is wonderful and one should go for one of the treatments there. It sure is a terrific experience.The pool and the bar was really nice. Unfortunately we did see some women wearing non swimming attire and getting into the pool . That was for a short time and I hope they were ticked off.They ought to be extra strict with such things.I would definitely recommend it to others and perhaps stay there again .
reviews.title: not the place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very good value for money. We stayed in a deluxe room for RM330 a night (A$105). Room was large and clean with a balcony opening directly onto the garden about 50 m from the excellent pool. Maid service was very good as was check in/out. The breakfast spread was just OK but overpriced compared to other options available locally. The resturant straight across the road from the hotel was good and cheap but the best breakfast (or lunch) in town is undoubtably at the Red Tomato Cafe; if you have a car.
reviews.title: Excellent value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from langkawi this evening. Booked this hotel via website and was rather skeptical when I read so many mixed reviews on this hotel. Nevertheless, I decided to go ahead with it. And the verdict?? Generally, this is a good hotel. I have to be fair when it comes to judging a hotel. One simply cannot compare an apple with an orange. I booked the Superior room which is the cheapest room possible, facing a garden view and on the ground floor. The workmanship is on the flooring is not good but what do you expect from a hotel which has been built for quite sometime! The pool is excellent because it is huge, the shape is nice( unlike the rectangular olympic pool), it has a jacuzzi, child pool, plenty of beach bench, pool bar, great beach and place for beach volleyball. Other amenities include 3 well maintain tennis court and 2 ping pong tables. The bed is not so soft, aircon is cold and room comes with safebox and hair dryer. My room is not carpeted and I am not sure about other more expensive rooms. So, bring along your bedroom slippers for cleanliness and also to avoid stepping on cold floor. Bathroom is huge with a bathtub. All rooms comes with a balcony with 2 chairs. TV channels provided are quite ok and comes with remote control The only not so good thing about this hotel is the breakfast. Choices are limited.
reviews.title: Poor Facilities, but a great beach and pool

aka: Holiday Villa Beach Resort & Spa Langkawi Hotel
description: This enchanting 4-star picturesque resort is sprawled over 13 acres of land, fronting on one of Langkawi island's finest beach, Pantai Tengah. Here, our 258 guest rooms and suites range from the simple elegance to the truly extravagant.
